mods.abstract: Mulatto-Woman in Jail. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 9th instant, a mulatto-woman calling herself Eloise (but recognized here to be Magdeleine), and saying she belongs to Mr. E. I. Guegnon, of the Parish of Lafayette. This mulatto-woman is about 25 years old, of ordinary size, speaks French and English. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take her away, otherwise she will be dealt with according to law. LOUIS L. BOUTTE, Jailor. Opelousas, August 12th, 1854.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
